author: nothappygooutside
comment: yes i've seen it before. someone failed the entire thing because of one assignment, he didn't read the instructions properly and wrote something completely irrelevant. CICT is usually non-graded so just put minimal effort in it to pass. but the keyword is minimal effort, not lacklustre effort, so make sure to read the marking rubrics before each assignment.
analysis:
```json
{
  "sentiment": "negative",
  "topics": ["academic"],
  "complaints": ["Failure due to a single assignment and not reading instructions", "Irrelevant work submitted"],
  "suggestions": ["Read marking rubrics before each assignment", "Put in minimal effort but not lackluster effort"]
}
```

author: nothappygooutside
comment: um... we actually had a falling out and cut contact so i don't know how he performed for his remod, but he did post on his story his grades for sem 1.1 and his CICT was a "Fail". i assume he did remod as i continued seeing him in school. if you fail any subject then you'll have to remod! thankfully CICT is not graded, so you really just need to put in the bare minimum to pass next time. and this won't affect your gpa but you are no longer eligible to get a diploma with merit or be in the director's list.
analysis:
```json
{
  "sentiment": "negative",
  "topics": ["academic", "grades"],
  "complaints": ["Failing a subject (CICT) requires re-taking the module.", "Failing a subject impacts eligibility for merit and director's list."],
  "suggestions": []
}
```
